sermons.title: (Revelation - Part 2): A Prognosis of Events
sermons.description: Without prophecy, modern Christianity would be in pretty bad shape; Revelation is the disclosing of that which could not otherwise be known; How curiosity comes near to blasphemy; No secret key to understanding the Scriptures; Merely knowing the Scriptures profits us nothing; Many things God has given us as blessings have been turned into curses; Knowing the meaning of the symbols in Revelation will not make us any better off; When the Lord will come is of less importance than whether we are prepared when He does.

sermons.title: A Voice From Heaven
sermons.description: DELIVERED BY C. H. SPURGEON, AT THE METROPOLITAN TABERNACLE, NEWINGTON. “Here is the patience of the salute: here are they that keep the commandments of God, and the faith of Jesus. And I heard a voice from heaven saying unto me, Write, Blessed are the dead which die in the Lord from henceforth: Yea, saith the Spirit, that they may rest from their labors, and their works do follow them.” — Revelation 14:12, 13. THE text speaks of a voice from heaven which said, “Blessed are the dead which die in the Lord.” The witness of that voice is not needed upon every occasion, for even the commonest observer is compelled to feel concerning many of the righteous that their deaths are blessed. Balaam, with all his moral shortsightedness, could say, “Let me die the death of the righteous, and let my last end be like his.” That is the case when death comes in peaceful fashion. The man has lived a calm, godly, consistent life; he has lived as long as he could well have wished to live, and in dying he sees his children and his children's children gathered around his bed. What a fine picture the old man makes, as he sits up with that snowy head supported by snowy pillows. Hear him as he tells his children that goodness and mercy have followed him all the days of his life, and now he is going to dwell in the house of the Lord for ever...

sermons.title: CALL FOR THE END TIMES!
sermons.description: God lives and works today! In view of our day and age, it is of utmost importance that we respond to a special call from God, which we read about in the book of Rev. 14. It is the call to give God the glory. But what does this actually mean for our daily lives? Listen to the following meditation!

sermons.title: CALL FOR THE END TIMES!
sermons.description: In view of our day and age, it is of utmost importance that we respond to a special call from God, which we read about in the book of Revelation, Chapter 14. It is the call to give God the glory. But what does this actually mean for our daily lives?

sermons.title: Church History - Session 10 (Modern Times)
sermons.description: Parkyns highlights the developments of the Church in the 19th and 20th centuries, citing the unprecedented missionary expansion and great revivals, including the Pentecostal restoration and charismatic movement.  'Springtime and harvest,' he observes, 'are all in one.'  He then concludes the book of Revelation with a bit of review of chapter 14, historical fulfillment of the vials in chapter 15, and a panoramic sweep to the end of the book.

sermons.title: Church History - Session 9 (The Book of Revelation)
sermons.description: Parkyns continues from Session 9 (The Reformation) to describe the declining influence of the papacy as European nations broke away one by one.  He shows how there is a designed pattern and contrast between the false church and the true church between Revelation 17 and 21.  Parkyns describes the exciting historical fulfillment of the first six angels of Revelation 14 and how the final one has yet to call out for a final harvest of judgment.

sermons.title: GIVE GOD THE GLORY!
sermons.description: Man was created for only one purpose - to bring God glory. Does your life do this? Kanaan is the home of the Evangelical Sisterhood of Mary, an international, interdenominational organization founded in 1947 within the framework of the German Evangelical (Protestant) Church. Website: www.kanaan.org

sermons.title: Hell is a Good Place - It Vindicates Gods Glory
Utter Committal To Jesus The Christ
sermons.description: This is a message from the last year of Brother Barnard's ministry. Preached at Greenwood Baptist Church Pasadena, Texas in Nov. 1968. Evang. Barnard went to be with the Lord in Jan. 1969.

sermons.title: Without Fault Before The Throne Of God
